headline: Apple Cinnamon Zucchini Muffins
description: Zucchini and apple muffins with a generous helping of cinnamon are a quick and easy breakfast treat to prepare.
name: Apple Cinnamon Zucchini Muffins
recipeIngredient: 1.5 tablespoons ground cinnamon, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray 24 muffin cups with cooking spray or line with paper liners.

Whisk sugar, oil, eggs, and vanilla extract together in a bowl until smooth. Stir flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and baking powder into sugar mixture just until batter is combined. Fold zucchini and apple into batter and spoon into the prepared muffin cups.
Bake in the preheated oven until until muffins spring back after pressing the top, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I just haven't eaten it yet. But it smells delicious. I just wanted to make a suggestion as to how to serve it. My first experience with zucchini bread was at a place in NJ called the Pub(at steak house). They served it on their salad bar, also on that salad bar was a huge bowl of applesauce that they had added diced maraschino cherries to. I put the applesauce on top of the zucchini bread and it was to die for. Now when I make applesauce I also add the cherries to it but when eating zucchini bread you can't do better then topping it with this mixture. It was better then the steak in my opinion. Just thought I'd share that with zucchini bread lovers.

The positives are that these muffins are moist and have a nice level of sweetness from the apple. The problem is the flavor is "meh", exactly as Cindy Koszegi described. I only really can taste the apple and maybe a tinge of cinnamon. I think more spices need to be added and maybe dice the apple for some texture or add nuts. I only made a half recipe and I'm glad I did; otherwise I would be eating these for quite awhile.
These were just ok. To enhance the flavor, salt should be added to this recipe, otherwise, it's pretty bland.
I made half a batch and used 1 x-large egg. I added salt and used ½ cup applesauce in place of the shredded apple. My daughter loved these, and I'm making again tomorrow. I only got 10 muffins.

I loved this recipe! I give it 5 stars. Although I'm borderline diabetic, I substituted Trivia for sugar. The name should be "Disappearing Apple Zucchini muffins". Everyone ate them up as soon as they were done. They loved them.

This was a very delicious muffin recipe. Instead of shredding the apple, I did 1.5 cups of small diced golden delicious apples. I also added chopped walnuts for even more texture. I only used 1.5 tablespoons of cinnamon. Next time I will add more. Mine baked in 20 mins, which I could have pulled a minute or 2 earlier. Made 24 muffins so I froze half for later.
Excellent Added Chopped Walnuts
Great taste&texture. I cut the sugar by half and still found them addictive. Easy mini muffin for my Childcare toddlers. Thank you

I made these a bit more healthy. than the original recipe, but they ended up still being yummy. I used 3/4 cup pure cane sugar, 1/2 olive oil 1/2 apple sauce for the 2/3 cup oil, used 1 1/2 cups whole wheat flower, and added nutmeg, cloves, and walnuts. My boyfriend who isn’t into healthy stuff said he really liked them. A total keeper.

I used 1 cup of chopped pitted dates in place of apples. 
Delicious
These muffins are so good they didn't last 30 min in my house
Really good muffins!

Delicious!! I had a few mealy Gala’s to use and decided to make these (glad I did!). I stuck fairly close to the original recipe - used 1c wheat flour + 1.25c all purpose, used 1 Tbps cinnamon + 1 Tbsp pumpkin pie spice, used 3/4c white sugar + 1/2c brown sugar (didn’t reduce sugar due to the overall quantity here), and added about 1c chopped walnuts. My batch made 18 reg size muffins + 3 giant size muffins. Great flavor, definitely not too sweet, and awesome crispy tops. I will definitely make this again!
Perfect amount of sweetness!
Made into bread loaves. Triple recipe made 4 loafs. Cut apples small
These are great muffins, added some raisins & coconut. Will make them again
I made it in my cast iron pan. Came out perfectly and tasted great!

Loved this recipe. I used 2 small zucchini and that was 2 cups shredded. I used I regular sized apple and that was 1 cup shredded. I used 2 tablespoons cinnamon and a dash of both all spice and nutmeg. Also added 1 cup walnuts. Very moist and wonderful. Will use this recipe again
Very good and moist!!
very good! Easy recipe.
This was the best zucchini recipe I have ever tried. We used a Cuisinart to do all the grating/chopping, etc. and then added walnuts. I am going to make more and freeze them for later.
My new favorite recipe!! So easy and the kids LOVE them!! I even snuck in some extra zucchini! Next time I am going to do carrots!! Thank you!!
I halved the recipe and used two eggs and a full teaspoon of baking powder, along with some grated nutmeg.
i didn't make any changes and it was amazing i would make it agen
easy to make and taste wonderful

Like others, I added spice: a couple of rounded tablespoons (probably almost 3, if level) of pumpkin pie spice. And, some salt. I also cut back on the oil, and added some plain yogurt. And, I toss walnuts into just about any muffin batter. So moist, so tasty, SO making these again. And, again... :)
These are the best muffins ever. Just made my 3rd batch. This time I used Apple's from our tree. I can't stop eating them especially when warm.

Uhhh SO yummy!!! I followed the recipe as it looked pretty solid, except I didn’t measure my zucchini or apple... I did peel both (2 small green apples and one whole zucchini) and pulsed them in the Ninja until slightly more than sliced (you don’t want them juicy) I also love wheat flour so I used 1c wheat and 1 1/4 white. I did add the extra cinnamon because we are cinnamon people!

Definitely 5 Stars! I did not have enough cinnamon on hand so, I used 1/2 t each of ginger, cloves & nutmeg and barely more than a T of cinnamon. Flavor is good but more cinnamon would be better. So for next time make sure I have plenty on hand.
Added a dash more vanilla and doubled cinnamon. This was amazing! Thanks for sharing. Will be making this one often.
This was a good recipe. The cinnamon added just enough extra flavor. I added two apples only because I love big bold flavors. I would make this again for sure.
I added a dash of nutmeg and will probably add some walnuts next time. Very moist and even better the next day. Will definitely make again.

The recipe is great. The muffins are moist and delicious. I find it can use some more zing, which is why I'm giving it a four star.

I'm using it now as a base, but cutting back on the cinnamon for freshly ground nutmeg and adding diced apples along with the shredded to give it more apple flavour and texture. 

This recipe makes a great loaf and I think I prefer that over the muffins. Pour the batter into a well-buttered loaf pan and bake at 350F for about 55 minutes. Moist and light and absolutely yummy!
These are sooooo good!!!
The muffins rose well and taste really good. I’d recommend adding honey on top.

Very good! I read everyone’s comments and incorporated the ideas. I used 1/2 of the oil with 1/2 cinnamon applesauce and added a little salt, some raisins along with a couple of shakes of Allspice, cloves and an extra 1/2 TBSP cinnamon. It made over 18 muffins. The kitchen smelled so good. Will make it again.
Great muffins! They are super moist and love the apples with the zucchini... I added a pinch of salt to balance the sweetness and it they turned out great!

I made two batches - 1st exactly to recipe and 2nd used as basis for a whole new recipe which turned out spectacular. As written this recipe is 'meh' at best lacking interest and very bland. Also too sweet for a zuch muffin. Second batch became whole wheat with sugar reduced to 3/4 c demerara sugar, added cloves, ginger and nutmeg, an extra scant cup zucchini, and an extra egg. This is now my go to recipe for zucchini bread and will make a batch of chocolate ones with the leftover zucchini.
Way to moist

They turned out perfect just the way the recipe was written. 

They are so moist, make sure to freeze or refrigerate them right away .
My husband is not a fan of zucchini but he raved about these.

I was looking for an apple muffin recipe to make for my baby and since this one had zucchini in it I figured that would be a bonus! Because I was making these for my 9 month old I left out the sugar. Still delicious! He loves them! So happy I found this recipe, I think it would work with carrots in place of the apple too and that's what my next batch will be!
These were good-but next time I would add salt. The flavor was slightly bland without salt.

Absolutely amazing !!! Made a batch last week and my 3 year old who refuses to eat fruits and vegetables ate so many of them and asked for more today.Made them again and he is loving it right this moment !!Thank you !
I followed the instructions to the T and they came out amazing! Moist and flavorful. And the house smelled great!

As I was short of zucchini I halved the recipe. I used two eggs and baked it in a small loaf pan for about 25 mins. at 350o. This was a very light, moist loaf and I will be making this on a regular basis. Definitely 5 stars.

As I was short of zucchini I halved the recipe. I used two eggs and baked it in a small loaf pan for about 25 mins. at 350o. This was a very light, moist loaf and I will be making this on a regular basis. Definitely 5 stars.

First, these muffins are AWESOME. I did make one change, but it was only because these sounded so yummy and I didn't have an apple. I substituted applesauce instead, and the muffins turned out moist and delicious. My 15-year-old son said they're the best muffins he's ever had. Thanks for sharing the recipe!!
We really enjoyed these muffins and I will make them again. I didn't make any changes.

I used 2 full tablespoons of cinnamon and added 1 teaspoon each of ground cloves and ginger and 2 teaspoons of nutmeg.

I think if I make it again I'll add a little more cinnamon and maybe some kind of chopped nuts.

I made the whole recipe with one change to it. I did not want the muffins to be dense, so I used the trick I found in another recipe, "Abbys Super Zucchini Loaf" in order to purge the zucchini of water. After that I followed the recipe as it is written. They were delicious and did not last a day in my house.

This one's a winner. I baked the muffins at 375F for 20 minutes instead of 350 for 25 minutes. And I added 1/4 cup of miniature chocolate chips. The muffins came out moist and flavorful and totally delicious. Even my picky daughter, Miss "I hate all fruit and most vegetables," loved them. I am keeping this recipe.

I substituted 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 3/4 cup of white sugar instead of using all white sugar and also added 1/4 tsp of ground nutmeg and 1/2 tsp of salt. I dusted each muffin with 1/2 tsp of cinnamon sugar before baking. The muffins were moist and light and tasted wonderful. Will definitely add these to our family recipe favorites.
I made it according to the recipe and the muffins turned out moist and tasty. Next time I will add some walnuts.
Was very moist & delicious. Only change I made was used half apple sauce & half oil.

Had zucchini from the garden and apples from our tree and thought what the heck? I substituted half the flour with whole wheat and 1/3 cup oil and 1/3 cup of homemade applesauce. I used 3/4 cup of brown sugar. I made them in my stand mixer and they turned out moist, not too dense and not too sweet. I will add nutmeg and all spice next time. Also it made 17 muffins not 24. My kids hate zucchini and they gobbled them up this morning!
Very moist and refreshing.
Really, really good! My family scarfed them up as quickly as the chocolate zucchini muffins!

I made these a bit healthier with the following changes and they still turned out perfect!
1.5 c. all purpose flour, 3/4 c. whole wheat flour.
1 T. cinnamon
1/2 c. white sugar, 1/2 c. brown sugar
1/3 c. oil, 1/3 c. applesauce
2 eggs, 1 T. milk
2 tsp vanilla
I used an electric mixer to combine wet ingredients, then folded in dry ingredients. Just made 17 muffins though.
I made this as I had all ingredients on hand and my zucchini garden was over growing.. followed the recipe exactly. I did only use one large zucchini, as it was huge.
These turned out great! I used one stick of butter instead of oil and added raisins. I will make these again. Very easy recipe. my batch did not turn out dense. great consistency
Made according to directions. Very good texture and taste. However, next time I will add 1/2 tsp of salt. It just seemed to be missing something.

These really deserve a three and a half. They're good for you, particularly if you make the changes I made - replace half the oil with applesauce and use light whole wheat flour. But I found them moist to the point of unpleasantly dense, and even with the addition of nutmeg and allspice, they were still a little bland. Still, the kids did eat them, and it's a breakfast I'm happy to give them, so that counts for plenty.

Pretty tasty, and kid-approved! I subbed cinnamon applesauce for half the oil and added a pinch each of allspice and nutmeg. Mine turned out moist, not dense, but I used about half a cup more shredded zucchini/apples than the recipe called for, so my batter was fairly watery. Filling the muffin cups about 3/4 full worked well. They're also popular as mini muffins (bake time about 14 minutes).
Made exactly as written, just used coconut oil for the oil, and whole wheat flour. Came out great!
I will keep this recipe, as they were so good! Very moist and not too sweet. I have 10 lbs of raisins to use up, so I put raisins in them and that's the only change I made. We loved these!
Yes I put in less sugar, next I'ok subtract more sugar we found it too sweet, but they were delicious. My granddaughter loved them.
These were delicious! Love being able to load up muffins with fruit and veggies.

DELICIOUS!!! I cut the recipe in half (and used one organic zucchinni and one organic apple, and two eggs), to make one dozen muffins. Also, needed to add about 10 minutes to the bake time. And I used parchment baking cups. The muffins turned out wonderfully moist and airy. Fantastic flavor!!
These muffins turned out great followed the recipe except I added a cup of raisins plan to try them frozen to just get out one or two for breakfast.

My 3-year-old and I liked these. I cut the recipe in half (3/4 a large zucchini, 1 small apple, 2 eggs, 1/2 C sugar, etc), which only made 9 muffins (filled the papers most of the way.) They were not quite finished baking at 25 minutes. We both said they taste good, and they're soft and moist. They need to cool fully before eating so they won't stick to the muffin papers. I agree that adding chopped walnuts would make them better.
These are absolutely fantastic!! Love them!!

After going apple picking today, I made these with my fresh picked honeycrisps. I used whole wheat flour and substituted half the sugar for 1 1/2 tbsp. fresh honey (cut oil down to 1/2 c. because of the added liquid). I also added some ginger and nutmeg. After the first batch came out of the oven, I added more of the spices to the rest of the batter. This is a delicious, lightly sweet, packed little muffin. I'm definitely looking forward to this autumnal breakfast treat. As with other reviews, if I would have had them on hand, chopped pecans and raisins would have been great additions!

Omg! Amazing! I have a ton of zucchini from my garden and decided to go with this recipe because it also has apples. I tripled the recipe so I can individually freeze them for the kids to have a quick and healthy breakfast. They turned out moist and fluffy. Not as dense as the other pics I saw (perhaps, because I almost doubled the zucchini and apples)? Absolutely perfect. I added raisins of course. ;) Thank you!
These were delicious but I like my muffins with "things" in them so I added 1 cup of raisins. Other than that, I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out perfect!
These were fantastic! Few adjustments:Low fat cottage cheese and a tiny bit of oil instead of all the oil.

These muffins turned out full of flavour, moist, and soft. My muffins often turn out too dense, so I was careful to not overmix. I used 3/4 cup sugar, subbed 1/3 cup coconut oil + 1/3 cup oil, and I added a splash of almond extract and a dash of cardamom and allspice to round out the flavour. Delicious.

The apples and cinnamon really make this special! It's a great muffin under 200 calories! Not over powering sweet! Nice and dense. Very satisfying! A great little cheat! I will share this with friends and will make it again!
This is an awesome recipe!! Even my super picky 3 year old son ate these! I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out very yummy and really moist.
Nutritionally dense muffins. My husband loves these. Packed with good things to help him power through his morning.

This recipe is delicious. I subbed wheat flour for white and yellow summer squash for zucchini. My kids loved them! I did cook them a little longer than called for and sprinkled the top with raw sugar.

I cut this recipe in half using two eggs, one apple and one zucchini. The result was a dozen very moist, tasty muffins. Next time, I think the addition of some walnuts and some extra spice would be nice. Thanks for the easy, tasty recipe, justsmurfy!

I like the taste, but I was hoping for them to be more like a banana cupcake, but they turned out very dense.
Hardly any air in them.

Loved it! Its an awesome twist on zucchinni bread! The apples and cinnamon really did the trick. This is a tasty and healthy subsitution for cupcake at family gatherings, office treats, and after dinner desserts! Thanks so much for the recipe!! Two thumbs up! P.s. For those who enjoy sugary snacks, this is probably not for you. Its mildly sweet and like i stated, much healthier for you :)

Delicious! A little like a fairly dense apple cake. Mine got sticky on top, but probably because I had to transport them with a lid before they cooled completely. I can't wait 'til the second batch gets out of the oven!
Very quick easy and delicious. Left out the egg (on accident) but the recipe still turn out very good, just a little more heavy. Delicious!

Super easy. I added some clove because I like that combination with cinnamon. I also added sugar in the raw on top for a crunchy top. I would have given a 5 but wasn't quite as "applely" as I was expecting.
Baking them now. I'm giving this a five because I know they're going to be great!
